title: Simplifying Denominators Containing Two terms
text: Given an expression with a radical term and a constant in the denominator, to rationalize the denominator find the conjugate of the denominator and then multiply the numerator and denominator by the conjugate.
speech: Given an expression with a radical term and a constant in the denominator, to rationalize the denominator find the conjugate of the denominator and then multiply the numerator and denominator by the conjugate.
pacedSpeech: Given an expression with a radical term and a constant in the denominator, to rationalize the denominator find the conjugate of the denominator and then multiply the numerator and denominator by the conjugate.

title: Simplifying Denominators Containing Two terms
text: The denominator is $$1+\sqrt{5}$$. So multiply the fraction by $$\frac{1-\sqrt{5}}{1-\sqrt{5}}$$.
speech: The denominator is  1 plus the square root of 5 . So multiply the fraction by  fraction, 1 minus the square root of 5 over, 1 minus the square root of 5  .
pacedSpeech: The denominator is   1 plus the square root of 5
. So multiply the fraction by   fraction, 1 minus the square root of 5 over, 1 minus the square root of 5

title: The Distributive Property
text: Use the distributive property to simplify: $$\frac{\frac{4}{1+\sqrt{5}} \left(1-\sqrt{5}\right)}{1-\sqrt{5}}=\frac{4-4\sqrt{5}}{-4}=\sqrt{5}-1$$
speech: Use the distributive property to simplify:  fraction, fraction, 4 over, 1 plus the square root of 5  times parentheses, 1 minus the square root of 5 , over, 1 minus the square root of 5  is equal to fraction, 4 minus, 4 the square root of 5 over, negative 4,  is equal to, the square root of 5 minus 1
pacedSpeech: Use the distributive property to simplify:  this expression
